definition: (bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)
(bound form used in 忙碌[mang2 lu4], 勞碌|劳碌[lao2 lu4], 庸碌[yong1 lu4] etc)
variant of 為|为[wei4], because of/for/to
variant of 為|为[wei2]/as (i.e. in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do
as (in the capacity of)/to take sth as/to act as/to serve as/to behave as/to become/to be/to do/by (in the passive voice)

sentences.english: As a result, many people live a mediocre life without living for a true purpose.
sentences.chinese: 结果很多人一生碌碌无为，没有真正的目标。

sentences.english: As for the wave is mediocre, and hard work is wise move.
sentences.chinese: 碌碌无为是庸人所为，奋发图强是智者之举。

sentences.english: Otherwise, if we do nothing allday , youth will slip away with time.
sentences.chinese: 若是碌碌无为，那么，青春将会随着时间悄悄地溜走。

sentences.english: The problem with worry, among others, is that it steals everyday moments.
sentences.chinese: 忧虑不同于其他的问题在于，它会让你终日碌碌无为。

definition: to waste time on worthless activities
to have achieved nothing/to be a total failure/to get nowhere
to take things as they are (idiom)/to leave a situation as it is/to be happy with the status quo
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
attempting nothing and accomplishing nothing (idiom); without any initiative or drive/feckless
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
soured by the loss of one's hopes
lit. as a monk for today, toll today's bell (idiom)/fig. to do one's job mechanically/to hold a position passively
pinyin: zuo4 yi1 tian1 he2 shang5 zhuang4 yi1 tian1 zhong1
